metadata.title: CVE-2017-10807 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
JabberD 2.x (aka jabberd2) before 2.6.1 allows anyone to authenticate usingSASL ANONYMOUS, even when the sasl.anonymous c2s.xml option is not enabled.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10807` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

jabberd2 - 2.6.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jabberd2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.6.1-1').
